page.title: 03ALDBROUGH BECK
page.content:
This beck rises near Eppleby and flows East through Carlton to be joined by the Mary Wild Beck before it passes through Aldbrough. One mile further on the stream becomes known as the Clow Beck by which name it continues to be known until it flows into the River Tees near Croft some seven meandering miles further on.
The beck contains fresh water trout, bullheads, minnows and sticklebacks or rather it did, until a few months ago when it became polluted by silage effluent from one of the bordering farms near Carlton. The Northumbrian Water Authority who control water courses in this area did not prosecute the offender but are to require him to restock the beck with appropriate species of fish in the near future.
